tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE volunteer_training (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_name VARCHAR(255),
    training_name VARCHAR(255),
    certification_date DATE,
    expiration_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE volunteers (
    volunteer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_name VARCHAR(50),
    certification_id INT,
    certification_expiry_date DATE
    FOREIGN KEY (certification_id) REFERENCES certifications(certification_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Volunteer (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    phone VARCHAR(15),
    address TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE Training (
    training_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    instructor VARCHAR(50),
    duration INT
);

CREATE TABLE Certification (
    cert_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_id INT,
    training_id INT,
    certification_date DATE,
    expiration_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES Volunteer(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (training_id) REFERENCES Training(training_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Compliance (
    compliance_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    certification_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    review_date DATE,
    notes TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (certification_id) REFERENCES Certification(cert_id)
);

CREATE TABLE volunteer_training (
  training_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  volunteer_id INT,
  certification_id INT,
  training_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteers(volunteer_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (certification_id) REFERENCES training_certifications(certification_id)
);

CREATE TABLE training_sessions (
  session_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  training_id INT,
  instructor_id INT,
  session_date DATE,
  start_time TIME,
  end_time TIME,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  FOREIGN KEY (training_id) REFERENCES volunteer_training(training_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (instructor_id) REFERENCES training_instructors(instructor_id)
);
